Quotes:
[]Author: Marcos Chavarria;
Rating: 5
When: 2 months ago
So beautiful, and so crowded sometimes. It is sometimes impossible to get a good picture in this plaza, but it is Rome, you need to enjoy the life that comes with it. Is a great place to have dinner and if you wait time enough you can take a very good night picture. Just be patience.

Author: Creative Jay;
Rating: 5
When: 7 months ago
Incredible place. The massive church as you walk onto the plaza is amazing. Make sure you go inside and view it, words can not describe how stunning it is. Go day or night and enjoy this place. The only negative is the restaurants. Just avoid them if you can

Author: Shelby Elkins;
Rating: 5
When: 2 weeks ago
Free to enter and walk around. Beautiful fountains, access to a nice church, and plenty of places to eat. A must visit site when you are in Rome! Highly recommend!

Author: Bert Parham;
Rating: 5
When: 9 months ago
A fantastic place to go and people watch, enjoy pretty good food and ice cream. We visited several times as our hotel was in close proximity. Each time of day brings something different.

Author: Kai;
Rating: 5
When: a week ago
It was really calming and relaxing. Honestly I would love to go there again. The restaurants and coffee shops where top quality and the place was magnificent.

[]Author: Ghazzal Mehdi;
Rating: 5
When: 9 months ago
Surely a five star place. Perhaps the most iconic in Rome? To be honest, Rome has so many iconic places that I lost the count... Anyway, near to. Vetican, great bridges.. Simply outstanding...

Author: Marcos Chavarria;
Rating: 4
When: 2 months ago
Greater sight from the outside, I hope the pictures make sense of the very nice place this is. The architecture is different from other landmarks as it was intended for a different purpose in the religious history. Prepare to walk a lot. I would recommend the walking tour if possible.

Author: Marcel van Poeijer;
Rating: 4
When: 4 months ago
This huge Castle is definitely worth a visit. Even though I did not go in (entrance fee = 15EU), I still loved the outside area and the little park next to it. When you go inside, it is recommended to go before sunrise, as the sunrise view on top of the terrace should be lovely.

Author: Ken Saberi;
Rating: 4
When: 7 months ago
Great place to visit with spectacular views all around Rome. Interesting artefacts and some Papal history to see. Some of the rooms are stunning. There are a lot of stairs so people with mobility issues may struggle although there is a lift to the second level which can be used on request. This does mean that you will lose out on the top terrace which provides the best views. All the staff were extremely helpful and kind.

Author: Rich;
Rating: 3
When: 8 months ago
A fine visit. The best thing about this castle is the view you get once you're on the top floor.

[]Author: Wunderklumpen;
Rating: 4
When: 8 months ago
It is okay. But not worth to visit.

Author: Marlene Münch Schuster;
Rating: 4
When: 8 months ago
As most piazzas, it is beautiful. And I like Giordano Bruno, although I have been told he was lacking charm

Author: SilverWolf Beats;
Rating: 5
When: in the last week
A good place to spend time with friends and family. There's bars, restaurants and many more. Police is always visible in the area to insure people follows safety protocol. Just a five minutes walk from the main road..

Author: Deniz Hassan;
Rating: 5
When: 9 months ago
Splendid square comprised of four roughly equal sides. It houses several pleasant establishments for drink and food. The water fountain has excellent pressure and nice, cool water.

Author: Vladimir Balaz;
Rating: 5
When: 3 months ago
The place is famous for final moments on Giordano Bruno. The place, however, also has its own atmosphere. It is lively, with many people, shops and cafes. And there are flower shops as well, of course.

[]Author: Aayush Khandelwal;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
It's worth to visit. Look at the alignment with St Peters basilica. Sit near by on bridge and feel the beauty of place and architecture.

Author: Vasilis Karaman;
Rating: 5
When: 4 months ago
Amazing bridge! The most beautiful I have ever seen. All these statues all over the road are in the highest level! At the night this beauty increases!!

Author: Father Kenny Ang;
Rating: 4
When: 7 months ago
Seeing the statues of Saints Peter and Paul at the eastern end of this bridge reminds me that I’m standing in a city that witnessed the life of the early Christians. When I came here about two years ago, there were people dressed as Roman soldiers with whom tourists eagerly took pictures (I did too!). Unfortunately, I see that many visitors missed the ten statues of angels holding the symbols of Christ’s Passion devised by none other than Bernini (he wasn’t the only sculptor though; other sculptors collaborated in the project).

Author: Dom Swatton;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Couldn't recommend this bridge more for crossing the water. It has everything you need, clearly marked walkways, cobble stones and even statues. Great views of the homeless camping along side the water. Simply stunning

Author: מאור לוי;
Rating: 5
When: 4 months ago
Their shark was, in this moment, a pioneering sheep. Credible grapefruits show us how goldfishes can be snails. An eager chicken is a grape of the mind! A powerful melon without bees is truly a chicken of boundless melons. Recent controversy aside, the chimpanzee of a peach becomes a painstaking lime; Few can name an amusing fish that isn't a confident camel. After a long day at school and work, they were lost without the pro-active giraffe that composed their peach. After a long day at school and work, a sympathetic squirrel without sheeps is truly a giraffe of dynamic sharks; Few can name a skillful lime that isn't a decisive cat. The kumquat is a cow!

[]Author: Ken Saberi;
Rating: 4
When: 7 months ago
Not the cheapest but a nice atmosphere and generous portions. The waiting staff were very helpful.

Author: vektor57;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Hank did it again! A beautiful restaurant and Bulldog experience in one of the most historical plazas in Rome! Great drinks as well!

Author: J T;
Rating: 4
When: 2 years ago
Interesting place. Seemed to be a chain, which isn't as common in Italy as it is here. We didn't eat anything, just had drinks. Drinks were fine, but it's more of a bar for beer and sports. It satisfied though since we were stopping every so often to grab a drink and snack before we moved on to the next place.

Author: Steve Lipp;
Rating: 5
When: 2 years ago
Nice, cosmopolitan place with local and international brews and drinks. Didn't try burgers but they look delicious. Crew is very hospitable. Would recommend.

Author: Matt Smith;
Rating: 5
When: 10 months ago
Hope the staff and bartender Luana are doing well....great bar!!!

[]Author: Thomas Bollman;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
This place is much much bigger than it looks when you first walk in. Lots of places to sit and lounge around. Bartenders were very nice and their English was fine. Great for groups to sit around a table to have a drink or seven. Will go back on my next trip to Rome and when I’m not so hungover already.

Author: Pondz Meme;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Great staff. Great food. Great wine. Great price. The place is great. I threw a gathering for 17 people for my 19th bday and it was so nice. Totally recommend!!

Author: Michal Glinka;
Rating: 3
When: 2 years ago
We arrived around 7pm for some good cocktails, but there was no other guests at the time. The bar was completely empty. The service was very good. The style of the bar is probably dated to the 90/00's looking on the interieur.

Author: Wesam Rukun;
Rating: 3
When: a year ago
An ok food. But the location is great.

Author: Jorge R Tomey;
Rating: 4
When: 2 years ago
Good decor, gin and tonics €8 per. Closes at 0200h. Music wasn’t very good.

If you are under 25 years old it is €2. Good scenic view on top of the Castle.

Author: Shelby Elkins;
Rating: 5
When: 2 months ago
The park is free to access and has some very nice views! There are plenty of benches to sit on and relax. People also ride their bikes, play with their dogs, and eat snacks from nearby food trucks. Highly recommend!

Author: Joeni Arianto Kurniawan;
Rating: 5
When: 3 months ago
A pleasant park, very comfortable for exercise, at the center of Rome.

Author: Mateusz Ciarkowski;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Really nice park to have a night walk with your secon half, take wine with you and enjoy. On one side of the park you have massive castle Castel Sant'Angelo, on the other side you have Tyber River. Just next to the river you can find some stalls with souvenirs.

Author: Conor Kehoe;
Rating: 5
When: 7 months ago
Very nice panoramic views of the city. The park is beautiful with a lovely atmosphere inside
